intro: Trixis rigida, commonly known as rigid trixis, is a flowering plant native to the arid regions of southern Africa. It belongs to the family Amaranthaceae and is characterized by its upright, branched stems and small, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to withstand high temperatures and low rainfall. Its leaves are usually narrow and covered in a fine layer of hairs, which helps reduce water loss. Trixis rigida is often found in open habitats such as grasslands and shrublands.
